general_feedback: May be it is more convenient to classify if two sentences have the same meaning or not

While I don't think Image-Captcha is good either, this feels overly limiting because it relies on native-like levels of language proficiency. The type that I like the most is the slide the puzzle piece into place in an image one. This is far more intuitive and more generally applicable than the visual acuity required for Image-Captcha or language proficiency required for sentence meaning challenges like this.

challenge_feedback: No (it may be more time consuming and may be difficult for many people)

Only if this study revealed inter-rater agreement that was EXTREMELY high.  Otherwise, this is probably too subjective for such a use and would result in frustrated users not being able to buy Taylor Swift tickets and the like.
general_feedback: Very interesting study; best of luck to you!

challenge_feedback: Depends on the difficulty. The sentences in this survey were easy to label, however, if they are more complicated and require re-reading multiple times, then I'd rather use an image captcha
no, because image captcha is still more clear imo
general_feedback: none, its a great idea, i just think people will give very different scores

challenge_feedback: No. Clicking on little squares is more fun.
